attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Take all efforts to push for a ceasefire in Syria.
attributes.background: The bombing of rebel-held areas by the Syrian government and its allies has intensified in recent weeks. Countless civilians have suffered as a consequence - particularly in the Eastern Ghouta enclave. The UK must use its position on the UN Security Council to push for a ceasefire.
attributes.additional_details: The UN has made several calls for a ceasefire across Syria in the past few weeks. An ultimate resolution to the conflict seems distant. However, the immediate aim must be the protection of civilian life and civilian infrastructure. The UK must use its position on the UN Security Council, and its voice in Parliament, to condemn the Syrian government and call for an immediate and unconditional ceasefire.

attributes.action: Include teaching on online safety to children in all Primary & Secondary schools
attributes.background: Children and young people are increasingly vulnerable to online bullying, abuse and exploitation, as well as serious crime networks.This needs to be acknowledged in schools, and children need to be empowered to better protect themselves and their peers from online abuse.

attributes.action: Create an age limit and a license for all dog owners
attributes.background: Hoping to change the law so that anyone who wants to own a dog has to be 21 plus and also have to buy a license for dogs deemed 'bad breeds' such as bull mastiffs, bull dogs, staffies to stop idiotic people from having 'easy' access to these dogs.
attributes.additional_details: In may 2017 a family pet was mauled by 3 big dogs, described as bull mastiff, pit bull and staffordshire bull terrier dogs, the family pet was a king charles cavalier which stood no chance against these 3 massive dogs, but somehow the dog survived. The owner of the dogs is a young lad who has been training them to rip apart cats and lets them run loose when going for walks. 28th Jan 2018 they attacked a Labrador and killed it, again the owner just walked off with the dogs.

attributes.action: Ban Plastic envelopes and Paper catalogues, where seller has e-mail details.
attributes.background: Having just received 5 "mail shots" in one postal delivery,from Internet retailers, they all went straight into recycling. Waste of plastic, paper, fuel and postage costs. All the Internet Retailers have my e-mail address and could just as easily have e-mailed their brochure saving all of the above.

attributes.action: Scrap the tax on child support for victims of domestic abuse.
attributes.background: The Child Maintenance Service charges parents for utilising their managed service. The charge is in place to cut costs and encourage ex-partners to engage. Victims of domestic abuse shouldn't be punished financially because of an abusive ex-partner and, for safety, shouldn't be encouraged to engage.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government are taxing victims of domestic abuse every month for using their safest method of receiving Child Maintenance. At present, 4% of what a parent is entitled to is taken by the Government despite no other option being available.
This year, legislation to tackle domestic violence and abuse will come before the House of Commons. This petition is calling on the Government to use this opportunity to scrap the tax on child support for victims of domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Make the vehicle log book(V5C) proof of ownership
attributes.background: A motor vehicle is usually of high value, easily identified and in the public eye. It is also generally bought and sold several times throughout its lifetime.The UK does not, surprisingly have any 'Ownership Title' document, which is a bit weird when you think about it.
attributes.additional_details:
The DVLA, Government, Police, Finance Companies etc., all have their own reasons and all of them can explain the current form of V5C but it does not help and it does not matter.
 What matters and is very important is your opinion. You, the reader, can change something for the better. Here, now! Think about you and others. Make it simple, easy and clear. Protect yourself against problems! Protect yourself from crooks and criminals, scammers and thieves! 
 If you want an ownership title for your vehicle/motor then please, please sign this petition! Make your opinion count! Make the V5C proof of ownership!
Thank you

attributes.action: Grant my sick mum indefinite leave to remain
attributes.background: On 24/11/2017 my mum was detained at a IR centre and hastily removed from the UK giving us little time to prepare given her age. The NRC just sent her back without proper consultation or duty of care as to how she would be cared for once she is there, since her immediate family is here in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My father was a political refugee following the 1980 elections in Jamaica, it was hard for mum as a single mother with little education. I migrated to the UK in 1997 to join my wife who was having our first child. My mum traveled back and forth to the UK for visits. When we were about to have our 3rd child in 2002, we decided that it was best for her to stay and that was the start of our struggles with the Home Office to get them to grant her indefinite leave to remain.

attributes.action: Scrap school league tables to reduce pressures on young people and teachers
attributes.background: At the root cause of mental health difficulties in young people are league tables. There is pressure on students and staff to succeed as they are judged on exam performance data. Students with special educational needs flounder or move from mainstream schools which are struggling to be inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
The government recognises the need to transform the mental health provision for children and young people (Green paper, Dec 2017). Whilst the proposals are welcomed, it would make sense to address the underlying causes. 
The Guardian stated that exclusions are increasing partly because schools are under pressure to compete in league tables and exam results. Disruptive,vulnerable pupils who are likely to lower overall GCSE performance are weeded out before their national tests (Oct 2017).

attributes.action: On four lane motorways, restrict HGV vehicles and coaches to lanes 1 and 2.
attributes.background: The country has spent billions in upgrading traditional motorways to four lane smart motorways, however all this investment is wasted as soon as you get three trucks trying to overtake each other at 55mph. Trucks should be limited to lanes 1 and 2 to allow faster travellers to go in lanes 3 and 4.

attributes.action: Use the money needed to change the passport colour for the NHS and the homeless
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has just announced that after Brexit our passports will change colour. This seems completely unnecessary and the money and resources needed could be put to better use like helping our underfunded NHS and helping homeless people off the streets.

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to choose the colour of their own passport.
attributes.background: This petition would permit each individual citizen to choose their own passport colour, which should be possible regardless of the eventual outcome of Brexit. Contrary to popular opinion, the EU does NOT mandate the passport colour of its member states.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect students from universities and letting agencies
attributes.background: Started by a student who has had exposure to injustice in regards to university, letting agencies and landlords. University is stressful as it is, let alone overpaying for a property that isn't fit for purpose. I want to make life bearable for students who want to better themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be illegal for:

- Letting agencies and landlords to let below par properties for high rent.

- Universities who knowingly deliver below par education and still charge high fees.

- Letting agencies and landlords to overcharge student deposits.

One in four students suffer with mental health problems. Students are currently vulnerable and have no protection from the government against these flaws.  Students need to be taken seriously and be seen as the future of this country.

attributes.action: Make local councils install CCTV outside schools to reduce the risk of accidents
attributes.background:
We all see lazy parents dropping their children off at school. 

This petition is to ask the government to make it compulsory for local councils to install cctv outside schools to catch and fine drivers who ignore road safety. In an attempt to persuade lazy drivers not to park on zig zag markings.

attributes.action: Stop the UK goverment from giving more than £20 billion to the EU.
attributes.background: Looking at net figures Britain has consistently paid billions of pounds to the EU usually only Germany contributing more. We have given so much over the years to help other EU members but with public services now struggling to meet the demands put on them it is time to put our own people first.

attributes.action: Campaign for a Festival of Britain 2021 to celebrate 70 years since last one
attributes.background: UK has faced years of austerity - likely to continue up to 2021. This would give the British people a feel-good factor and added  prestige throughout the world, which will promote tourism.  An opportunity for trade and industry visits from other nations to showcase the UK as open for business
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the previous Festival of Britain in 1951 and look at what events occurred from those days and consider an updated version which included London and other provincial cities.   Put into place exhibitions, the provision of a festival ship (which occurred previously to promote British ports and industry).  Ask other major cities to put on events that may be a speciality to that particular region (eg historical interests and future innovations).

attributes.action: Require online retailers and platforms to disclose courier before order placed
attributes.background: When ordering goods online, websites generally do not state which courier service they will use for delivery. However, several courier companies have a track record of poor customer service and losing/damaging parcels. If consumers know which courier will be used, they can choose not to order.
attributes.additional_details: For an example, view the "tweets and replies" at @myhermes

attributes.action: Continue the "Retained right of residence" for former Spouse of  EEA nationals
attributes.background:
Under Current EEA regulations, former spouses of EEA nationals, retain their right to reside in the UK, even after they cease to be family members of an EEA national.
.
attributes.additional_details: This is a vital protection, as this covers former spouses who have been the victims of domestic voilence and other vulnerable people. Furthermore, people who retain their right of residence, are living in the UK by the virtue of EEA law, and so it is only fair that these people are also covered by the brexit negotiations and the protections afforded to EEA nationals are also extended to those people who retain their right of residence

attributes.action: Relocate UK parliament and government departments somewhere outside London.
attributes.background:
The Palace of Westminster is in poor condition, requiring £4B of refurbishment work, at state expense. It's, also, regularly argued that government is too London-centric.
It's time to relocate government to a new common site, outside London, and use Westminster Palace as a commercial asset.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, Westminster Palace is a far from suitable place from where to run government and, overall, London is over-crowded, costly and detached from much of the country. Considering these points, I propose constructing a modern government campus, in a more central location, with good London transport links, perhaps, somewhere around where the M1 and west-coast main lines converge, in Northamptonshire.
The campus should include a station and accommodation for MPs staying away from home.

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Form a cross-party commission (national consensus) which negotiates Brexit
attributes.background:
I  think that the issue is too important, so we have to get it right. Such a Independent cross-party, all encapsulating approach will be formidable.
1. It will represent all of us 
2. it will show at the negotiations that; we mean Business! 
3. The whole nation will be behind it
attributes.additional_details:
When we and future generations look back at these historic times we can then at least know for sure that everyone took part and was represented in this monumental decision and effort of exiting the EU. And did it as seamlessly as possible.    

If we do not negotiate with national consensus the chances of us and the future generations resenting the actions that were taken will be inevitable.

eg. the IRAQ WAR and the Chilcott report

attributes.action: Every person in the UK to be given a tree to plant to reverse UK deforestation
attributes.background: The UK is believed to be in deforestation (cut down more trees than are planted). This is on top of the UK tree land mass (13%) is far behind other countries, EU (38%), Japan (68%), USA (34%). If every person in the UK were given a tree to plant the UK tree population could dramatically increase

attributes.action: Make alcohol activated immobilisers mandatory on all new vehicles
attributes.background:
On average 3,000 people are killed or seriously injured each year in drink drive collisions
One of these was my friend, someone's husband, and about to be a father
If cars, motorbikes and vans were fitted with a breathalyser linked to the immobiliser, not one of these tragedies would have happened
attributes.additional_details:
Just think about what you do when you get in your car - you put your seatbelt on, turn the ignition on and release the handbrake. One small extra step to breathe into a breathalyser before your engine will turn on would be nothing. 
The cost of these units is around £1000, but vehicle (and motorbike) manufacturers could drive that cost right down with bulk orders.
They have been around for years - why are they not an every day part of cars and motorbikes?

attributes.action: Require hoists and proper facilities to be installed in all disabled toilets
attributes.background: Whilst out I needed cleaning and changing. My nephew had to physically lift me out of my wheelchair and hold on to me to clean and change me. It was difficult and I could easily have had a fall and he could have hurt himself. All disabled toilets need a hoist and proper changing facilities.

attributes.action: Stop paying wealthy pensioners the  tax-free winter fuel payment.
attributes.background: Our country needs to stop giving away  money to those who don't need it. The revenue from not paying EVERY pensioner the tax free money can better be used to help th struggling health system.

attributes.action: Give Retained Firefighters the right to leave employment to respond to 999 calls
attributes.background: Retained Firefighters make up a majority of the fire stations across Norfolk. Retained FireFighters drop their responsibilities the second their alerters alarm. Heading towards the fire station to respond to a 999 emergency.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm appealing for the rights of these firemen to be able to leave their employment to respond to life changing 999 calls . 

I aim to make it a law that employers have to allow retained Firefighters to leave their workplace to respond to these fire calls .

attributes.action: The council  to provide 24/7 childcare service to enable anyone access to work.
attributes.background: I am a single parent trying to do evening classes and work, however I am finding it impossible to access registered childcare after 6pm or weekends.  I have spoken with the head teachers in schools and they also agree that they all have many parents who don't have support,  nurses, or shift-workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare could be provided by the council 24/7 and staff located in any area.  This means people can work in extended jobs and is important in many sectors of work.  The private childcare arrangements is not supportive and last minute emergencies is unobtainable. 
If the council provided help with limit of children and let the establishment grow then it will provide more work to qualified childcare support and enable parents to work and not be discriminated against as currently they are.

attributes.action: Be illegal to drive tractors on A roads between the hours of 8am to 7pm
attributes.background: Tractors and other slow moving farm vehicles are a menice to other road users due to them causing large tailbacks which make people take risks to over take.

attributes.action: Zero Rate all School Uniform for VAT regardless of size.
attributes.background: Children’s clothing is zero rated for VAT depending on size. But, larger school uniform is zero rated for children under 14 if it is unique to a school. No child can leave school before age 16, so this is unfair.  All customized school uniform, should be zero-rated, regardless of age.

attributes.action: Prescribe dance fitness classes on the NHS for everyone's good health
attributes.background: Classes like Zumba should be free and prescribed to everyone on the NHS as they provide multiple health benefits including losing weight and has been known to fight depression.

attributes.action: A total ban on hunting for sport including the digging out of foxes and badgers!
attributes.background: Hunting for sport in the 21st century is both barbaric and cruel. Just because it's tradition doesn't make it right! It's not just the wildlife that suffers, dogs and horses suffer as well!

attributes.action: Reconsider the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: With the introduction of the Sugar Tax looming large, consumers are being constantly let down by the attempts of companies to avoid the higher rate of sugar tax and as a result the formulas they are releasing contain much higher levels of artificial sweeteners.
attributes.additional_details:
For some, the full sugar version of a drink not only tastes superior, it has beneficial effects, especially for people with a sensitivity to said artificial sweeteners.

A key example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). This wasn't announced in enough time for diabetic nurses to alter their recommendations.

All the tax is doing is punishing adult consumers. Why should we suffer this draconian approach to obesity?

attributes.action: Select members of the BBC board in the same way that juries are chosen
attributes.background: We believe that the BBC should be unbiased. There have been many accusations recently that there is right wing bias. In the past there have been accusation of left wing bias. At present government ministers decide who is appointed to the BBC board. This gives rise to conflicts of interest.

attributes.action: Investigate the risk to health from formaldehyde insulation in 1m older UK homes
attributes.background: As a social housing tenant in a former council owned property, now managed by a housing trust, I only discovered that it's cavity wall insulation contains formaldehyde (a known carcinogenic) when contractors negligently blew this noxious powder into my home & exposed us to its ongoing health risks!
attributes.additional_details:
Upon exposure to this atomised irritant, it was blasted into my home under 3,000 psi of machine fed pressure, I initially suffered a severe burning sensation in my eyes, nose, throat & chest, which continued to cause much discomfort for approx. 6 weeks afterwards; some of my neighbours were similarly affected.

On researching the topic I've discovered up to 1m older UK homes may be at risk of this hidden toxin & the EU's listed this substance as a contributory factor to leukemia & nasal cancer.

attributes.action: Restrict the public sale of fireworks to silent firework types
attributes.background: When it comes to Guy Fawkes night and New Years Eve the disturbance created by the sale of fireworks is extreme. The general public should only be able to purchase "silent fireworks" to limit the inconvenience they cause. Pets and people of nervous disposition experience terror during this time.
attributes.additional_details: My pet dog absolutely hates the time of year when Fireworks are let off, the sale of explosive fireworks should be banned and replaced with "silent fireworks" which are available on the Continent. This would allow people to enjoy the firework displays without disturbance to animals and people with young children. Restrict the sale of industrial strength explosive fireworks to licenced displays only

attributes.action: Ban unconditional offers for entrance to university
attributes.background: Universities have embarked on a race to the bottom in admissions standards in a now liberalised marketplace. To benefit society, the free market needs a framework of rules within which to operate. The government should legislate to prohibit this harmful practice, which is damaging pupil attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of unconditional offers for entrance to university made to 18 year olds in England, Wales and N.I. is exploding:

2013      3,000
2014    12,100
2015    23,400
2016    36,800
2017    51,600

UCAS recorded one in six applicants receiving one or more unconditional offers in 2017.

Such offers remove the incentive for pupils to work, leading to lower attainment at A Level, as UCAS' own research has demonstrated: see pages 18-9 of https://www.ucas.com/file/71796/download?token=D4uuSzur.

attributes.action: Philip Hammond to withdraw comments on disabled workforce lowering productivity
attributes.background: On the 6.12.17 the chancellor said to MPs at the Treasury Select Committee: "It is almost certainly the case that by increasing participation in the workforce for example of disabled people[...]may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements."
attributes.additional_details:
Rather than scapegoating disabled people through unfounded simplistic claims around a pretty complex matter Mr Hammond would benefit from reading this DWP commissioned report:

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20130314010347/http:/research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd5/rports2005-2006/rrep400.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwj-yP3UlYrYAhVI4KQKHd_mBpc4ChAWCCowAg&usg=AOvVaw3_mgkcqqS4_rwRlzoHoH3N

attributes.action: Relegalise the possession of fresh (unprepared) psilocybin ('magic') mushrooms.
attributes.background:
Psilocybin mushrooms have thousands of years of recorded human use. Studies indicate that they help sufferers of mental illness, depression, anxiety and many other medical conditions.

They are also used in many spiritual and religious practices and remain legal around the world.
attributes.additional_details:
Psilocybin mushrooms are non-toxic, are not addictive and have not been shown to have any detrimental effect on long-term mental health they grow naturally within the UK and continue to be sold legally in the Netherlands with no adverse consequences.

They have significant potential as medicines, with psilocybin being investigated as a treatment for depression, anxiety, addiction and PTSD. Research shows that just a single dose of psilocybin lifts anxiety and depression for six months or longer.

attributes.action: Make prostitution legal in order to make sex workers safe and keep them healthy.
attributes.background: For our citizenship GCSE qualification, we must choose an issue that we believe needs attention, and should be discussed as many people are being affected by the stigma on sex workers.This affects their health and safety as they are scared to be tested for STIs or report cases such as rape or abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Before creating this petition, we did research on both the advantages and disadvantages of legalizing prostitution and how it would affect people. We also conducted primary research and gave out a questionnaire in school asking teachers their opinion on the issue and explaining how people, especially sex workers, would benefit if it were legal. 61% of the teachers agreed that it should be legalized before we told them the advantages and disadvantages, and 75% agreed after learning the benefits.

attributes.action: Abolish taxation on voluntary tips for good service.
attributes.background: A tip is a voluntary gift from a person being served to a server and as such should be given tax exempt status. As many people who rely on tips are students, in between jobs or in low income families this would help ease ever increasing money burdens and possibly even stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: Limit alcohol labels and add warnings
attributes.background: Make alcohol branding limited to standard labels and add warnings to the label of future effects and long term illnesses.

attributes.action: To have a public holiday on 21 October to be called Trafalgar Day.
attributes.background: To commemorate one of the greatest days in our history.  We should be proud of that victory in 1805.  It is long overdue.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'no-fly' list banning disruptive & dangerous passengers from flying.
attributes.background: Presently several politicians claim the lack of alcohol-licensing at airports is to blame for an increase in air rage incidents.  Therefore several are pushing to restrict in-flight alcohol-sales at airports and in-flight, which would punish the majority.
attributes.additional_details: Instead of punishing the majority of decent passengers, a 'no-fly' list, similar to the one the Americans have, would be fairer on the majority of passengers and more effective in preventing alcohol-related problems like air rage.  Also the prospect of being given a lengthy or indefinite ban from flying would likely provide a much greater disincentive to avoid breaking the law during flights.

attributes.action: Make Tv licences free for students studying Media and/or television.
attributes.background: Living in London and being a student is expensive. That, combined with the low maintenance loans, budgeting is a big part of being a student. Paying £147 a year to watch television, that is involved in our study, means a lot of people don't have access to this resource due to their budget.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of media students I have spoken to have also gone without a television licence which has affected their study. However, students are not willing to break the law and pay the £1000 fine, just to help improve their research and their grade.

attributes.action: Award long service medals to doctors and nurses in the NHS
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services (police, fire and ambulance) are all awarded a long service medal after 20 years service but no recognition of long service is made for doctors and nurses who work in an equally challenging role, often dealing at the end point of emergencies.

attributes.action: Change Corporation tax so that only UK costs can be used to offset profits.
attributes.background: In the last week it has been reported that Ebay UK and AirBnB have both paid significantly less corporation tax than would seem fair, both have acted within the law that allows costs from abroad to be used against profits achieved in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: By only allowing costs incurred in the UK for UK tax purposes this would level the playing field, deter replacing of UK jobs with jobs in lower cost countries and improve tax revenues. This would also align with PAYE tax rules.

attributes.action: New Brexit Duty on all imports from Europe to UK to fund Brexit transition costs
attributes.background: The Brexit ‘divorce’ bill is effectively an import duty imposed by Europe on all UK export trades entering Europe.  Since the UK exports are less than UK imports from Europe, the logical measure would be to introduce an import duty on all European imports to offset any costs to the UK taxpayer.

attributes.action:
Award H/B so rents paid in full to parents/sons/daughters over 18
M/Severe ASD
attributes.background: No discrimination in H/Benefit.Rent for parents with children over 18 who have moderate to severe Autism Spectrum disorder should be paid in full as thousands of parents cannot work and are stuck on benefits due to lack of support as their young adult doesn't have the capacity to live independently.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is now 20 years old and does not have full coherency. I have singular guardianship. He receives very little support and I receive the same 10 hrs. At the last meeting social services wanted to 
drop those hours by a further 4. I cannot work because I am my sons 
full time carer, meaning I am forced to remain on benefits. I have rent & bills to pay not to mention ensuring that their are hearty meals on the table for a growing lad. My housing benefit doesn't cut it do S/Fall's still £374 pm

attributes.action: To stop lorries/buses overtaking on A roads and Motorways to reduce congestion.
attributes.background: The main problem on motorways is congestions and crashes. The problem is lorries are trying to overtake each other which takes too long which means the flow of traffic slows and causes congestion and crashes. It would stop the middle lane slowing which makes more cars stay in the middle lane.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/speed-limits

Above are the speed limits of vehicles over 7.5 tonnes to 60 mph which is 10 mph slower than the motorway speed.

attributes.action: Take in our fair share of refugees from the Mediterranean crisis
attributes.background: The crisis in the Mediterranean has seen a shocking display of reluctance to take action in order to help those fleeing war and disaster. Countries such as Italy have been left alone to disproportionately host refugees and asylum seekers. It's government's moral duty to host our fair share.
attributes.additional_details: In July 2017, Italy pleaded for the help of other European nations to deal with the record influx of refugees it was experiencing. In 2016, Italy took in a total of 181,436 people (TIME magazine). In 2016 the UK received 38,500 asylum applications, only 45% of these were granted (British Red Cross). The number of applications were considerably less than that of Germany (587,346) and Sweden (83,103).
